content.description: A cylinder with a moveable piston is completely filled with a small amount (100 millimoles) of liquid water at a pressure of <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1.0</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and a temperature of <math alttext="80 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>80</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. All the air in the cylinder is excluded. The cylinder is placed in a water bath held at <math alttext="80 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>80</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The piston is slowly moved out to expand the volume of the cylinder to <math alttext="20 liters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>20</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as the pressure inside the cylinder is monitored. A plot of the pressure versus volume for the system is shown in the figure above. Which of the following statements most closely indicates, with justification, the region of the curve where the equilibrium represented below occurs?
content.question: <math alttext="H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 2 O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: Region A, because the initial pressure inside the cylinder is equal to the pressure outside the cylinder, so there is no net force on the piston.

Region B, because the pressure inside the cylinder is equal to the vapor pressure of water at <math alttext="80 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>80</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when both liquid and gas phases are present.
Region C, because the water vapor is behaving according to the ideal gas law as expansion occurs.
Region D, because the pressure inside the cylinder has leveled off.

content.answer: Region B, because the pressure inside the cylinder is equal to the vapor pressure of water at <math alttext="80 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>80</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when both liquid and gas phases are present.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
